Our primary focus is human ex-sistence; our goal is to get to what accounts for the intelligibility of being. SZ I.1 is comprised of six chapters:
I. INTRODUCTORY
1. We distinguish this preparatory analysis from other, seemingly parallel studies. ◊
II. THE BASIC STRUCTE OF EXISTENCE: ENGAGEMENT WITH MEANING
2. A fundamental structure of ex-sistence is engagement with meaning [being-in-the-world of meaning: In-der-Welt-sein]. This engagement is a priori and is an inseparable organized whole with three major elements, which we analyze as follows:
III. THREE ELEMENTS OF THE ENGAGEMENT WITH MEANING
3. MEANINGFULNESS as what constitutes the whole of our engagement with meaning
4. BEING-WITH-OTHERS and BEING-ONE’S-SELF
5. ENGAGEMENT-WITH [the meaning-giving world]
IV. PROVISIONAL SUMMATION
6. The being of ex-sistence is CONCERN.
